definition: to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book

sentences.english: Each fold in the skirt should be exactly the same width.
sentences.chinese: 裙子每条皱折的宽度应该完全一样。

sentences.english: There is no obvious wrinkle caused by bending.
sentences.chinese: 管子弯曲处应无明显皱折。
半重瓣的深蓝色皱折菫型花。

sentences.english: His dark face is full of wrinkles, deep or shallow.
sentences.chinese: 他的黑脸上满是皱折，深或浅。

sentences.english: Could you iron the wrinkles in this blue shirt for me?
sentences.chinese: 你可以替我将这件蓝色衬衫上的皱折给熨平吗？

sentences.english: There are some wrinkles on the toe.
She ironed out all wrinkles in her dress.
sentences.chinese: 她熨掉了她裙子上的所有皱折。

sentences.english: Many carry creased copies in their wallets.
sentences.chinese: 不少人还将这篇皱折不堪的文章放入皮夹里随身携带。

sentences.english: The specimen don't allow folds and deformity on it .
sentences.chinese: 试样不允许有任何皱折与变形。

sentences.english: Its leaf has fold more, florescence is long, grade is high, be mother love is indicative.
sentences.chinese: 其花瓣多有皱折，花期长，品位高，是母爱的象征。

sentences.english: She patted the front of her dress as if to iron out any wrinkles.
sentences.chinese: 她轻拍裙子的前摆，好似要熨平皱折似的。

definition: variant of 皺褶|皱褶[zhou4 zhe3]
to flatten out (paper, film, metal plates etc)
welt seam (doubled over and sewed again from topside)
